descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course provides information about normal auditory development and the impact of impaired hearing in children. Etiological factors, assessment methods, and (re)habilitation methods including the use of sensory devices and counseling of parents related to impaired hearing are discussed.

KASA STANDARDS:
Theory and techniques associated with the following ASHA Standards are addressed in CSD 419. Knowledge and skills typically are acquired by exposure to information in more than one CSD course and through participation in clinical practicum.
B2. Patient characteristics (e.g., age, demographics, cultural and linguistic diversity, medical history and status, cognitive status, and physical and sensory abilities) and how they relate to clinical services
B3. Educational, vocational, and social and psychological effects of hearing impairment and their impact on the development of a treatment program
B5. Normal development of speech and language
B8. Normal aspects of auditory physiology and behavior over the life span
B17. Health care and educational delivery systems
B20. Laws, regulations, policies, and management practices relevant to the profession of audiology
B21. Manual communication, use of interpreters, and assistive technology
D7. Perform audiologic assessment using physiologic, psychophysical, and self-assessment measures
D8. Perform electrodiagnostic test procedures
E8. Recommend, dispense, and service prosthetic and assistive devices

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
By the conclusion of this course, the student will be able to:

  1. Describe normal auditory development

  2. Describe language, speech, motor, and other developmental milestones

  3. List etiologic factors contributing to impaired hearing

  4. Describe appropriate pediatric identification and assessment methods

  5. Identify appropriate sensory devices for use with children and describe device management techniques

  6. Describe (re)habilitation methods used with children with impaired hearing to develop auditory, language, and speech skills

  7. Describe current legislative mandates governing provision of services to children with impaired hearing

  8. Describe means of assessing family counseling needs and methods for providing such services

  9. Describe the steps of Evidenced Based Practice
